Reason: The 'dryRun' configuration option in the 'dconverter' software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. When set to true, the system may skip actual processing and only simulate the conversion process, leading to lower execution time and memory consumption. On the other hand, setting it to false will trigger the actual conversion process, potentially increasing execution time and memory usage. Therefore, the value of 'dryRun' directly influences system performance, making it a performance-sensitive configuration option.
